title: How to Get the Best Armour on Fallout 3

steps.headline: Start the Quest "You Gotta Shoot 'em in the Head".
steps.description: Talk to Mister Crowly in the Underworld (Museum of History). He will give you four targets. Do not worry about Allistair Tenpenny.

steps.headline: Travel to the Republic of Dave, to kill Dave for his key.
steps.description: Travel to Dukov's Place in D.C. for his key, and finally travel to Rivet City in D.C. for Ted Strayer's key.

steps.headline: With all three Keys travel to Fort Constantine, but be armed.
steps.description: There are a few combat robots. When you get there, go into a small building named "The Co-Quarters".

steps.headline: Proceed through (Note: There is a lot of nice Loot listed below) until you reach the body of Tara.
steps.description: Search it, and you will find a key.

steps.headline: Use that key to go through the next couple of doors and you will find a neon blue room (seen in intro Pic).
Go onto the terminal and disable the field.
steps.description: Take the best armour in the game. This will complete the quest "You Gotta Shoot 'em in the Head.

text: Start the Quest "You Gotta Shoot 'em in the Head". Talk to Mister Crowly in the Underworld (Museum of History). He will give you four targets. Do not worry about Allistair Tenpenny. Travel to the Republic of Dave, to kill Dave for his key. Travel to Dukov's Place in D.C. for his key, and finally travel to Rivet City in D.C. for Ted Strayer's key. With all three Keys travel to Fort Constantine, but be armed. There are a few combat robots. When you get there, go into a small building named "The Co-Quarters". Proceed through (Note: There is a lot of nice Loot listed below) until you reach the body of Tara. Search it, and you will find a key. Use that key to go through the next couple of doors and you will find a neon blue room (seen in intro Pic).  Go onto the terminal and disable the field. Take the best armour in the game. This will complete the quest "You Gotta Shoot 'em in the Head.
